title: How do musicians play their instruments? - Quora

response.answer_text: Q answered “How do musicians play their instruments” Pianists press the white and black notes on the keyboard, in order and for the right length and at the right time Guitarists push just above the fret, toward the nut with one hand and with the other, strum, pluck or use a plectrum (pick) with the left. something similar with the Uke, Mandolin, Bass, sitar and other variants The violins family players do it without fretting and either bow or pluck their strings with their hands. Drummers and other similar percussion instruments hit the drum with a stick. Or sometimes a brush Woodwind instruments most blow either a reed or tube and fiddle with valves to get their sounds. Vocalist do a type of pitched talking called singing. There are many others - all with variants on the themes. Turn out though, it’s not as easy as it looks. Getting all those notes played in the right order, at the right time and for exactly the right length. P.S. Ask a stupid question

I usually walk out to the shed, sit down, and play. Seriously, that’s what I do. If you do this daily for an hour a day, for 32 years you’ll pick up a thing or two, especially if put some structure to that playing. I see a lot of these questions, “How do you____?” As I have said before, the answer is always the same, you practice, practice, practice…
